results.title: [Eat LOUD carpet compilation]
results.creator_credit: LOUD Media Festival of Youth Culture and the Arts
results.brief_description: A collection of four short films from the SBS program, “Eat Carpet”, in which things aren’t always as they seem. “Goth to be Greek”, directed by Andrew Georgiou and Tim Slade, is the story of a goth who finally finds a woman who wears black and hangs out in cemeteries. “Bad news”, directed by Sofya Gollan, tells the tale of a profoundly deaf couple who react in an unexpected way after hearing some news from their apologetic doctor. “Skater, homie, skeggy, wog”, directed by Andrew Dowell and Brendan Dowell, focuses on some of the myths and misconceptions that teens from rival suburbs have regarding each other’s dress and way of living. “How black is black?”, directed by Jade Woods (aged 13), looks at the identity crises suffered by fair-skinned Koories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: LOUD Media Festival of Youth Culture and the Arts

results.title: [Dr. Stuart Fraser Home Movies: Tape 1]
results.brief_description:
Dr Stuart Fraser (b. 1898) was an amateur 16mm filmmaker. He studied medicine in Melbourne, graduating in 1923. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by his son, Graeme Fraser.

This film is a compile of various home movies, some under-exposed black and white and some in colour.

The films take place in several locations including suburban backyards and driveways, ski slopes, a farm and various unnamed beaches.

We see children enjoying a family beach holiday, children playing in front of a seawall and one scene shot from above a beach that takes in many beachgoers and a lighthouse.

Film consists of multiple examples of children playing in and around a suburban backyard in the 1930s. The children are seen playing with a variety of toys and riding tricycles and pedal cars, and occasionally tormenting the family dog.

At one point the film takes us to Porepunkah, Victoria. We see competition between seemingly amateur ski jumpers and cross-country skiers on unnamed ski slopes. We also see women standing at a mountain lookout looking across at other mountains.

The film contains scenes on farmland and scenes involving horses being ridden or fed. We see children dressed in school uniform riding horses in a small paddock and people riding horses on a beach track.

We also see a sheep being sheared with manual shears. At one point a boy dressed in full school uniform can be seen shearing the sheep.

Originally made using 16mm AGFA film.

Large sections of this film are under exposed.

Selected highlights list:
00:01:29:00 toddler kneeling in front of sea wall

00:04:04:00 boy pretending to eat a crab at the beach

00:05:37:00 a young girl at the beach wearing a bucket on head walks towards the camera carrying a small football by the laces

00:06:11:00 people walking a beach track towards the camera

00:06:40:00 people riding horses on a beach track

00:07:26:00 young boy holding a toy gun

00:07:50:00 two children digging at the beach

00:07:57:00 people canoeing toward the camera that appears to also be in the water or another boat

00:08:13:00 men in bathing costumes lifting children out of the water with beach huts seen in the background

00:09:17:00 children in driveway playing with toy cars and trains on string

00:09:34:00 three toy trains lined up

00:11:25:00 closeup of a young boy holding a toy bus in front of his face between him and camera

00:12:04:00 children playing on luggage and boxes possibly noting the end of a holiday

00:12:15:00 children on tricycles in backyard

00:12:50:00 children playing a in a disused chicken coop

00:13:43:00 children at a birthday party

00:14:13:00 girl on a seesaw in a suburban park

00:14:47:00 boy sliding down a slide backwards

00:15:45:00 boy playing on a disused canon

00:19:20:00 two children walk toward the camera, it cuts, and we see them walking away from the camera as if they walked through it and toward a house in the distance

00:20:07:00 three young children standing in front of a house

00:20:11:00 two girls in a boat on a river

00:21:48:00 people enjoying an indoor boat ride

00:22:18:00 as people ride the boats a Peter’s ice cream truck can be seen passing in the background

00:22:55:00 people riding a miniature railway

00:23:29:00 dodgem cars with attendants dressed in hats and white coats

00:26:10:00 children riding tricycles and pedal cars in a driveway with the family car parked in the background

00:26:41:00 three children lined up in or on their chosen tricycle or pedal car

00:27:08:00 a young girl teasing the family dog with a variety of toys before the dog snaps at her

00:27:35:00 children riding horses

00:29:57:00 man lights pipe before discarding a match in a paddock

00:30:27:00 two children annoying the family dog

00:31:10:00 persistent young girl sits on family dog

00:31:55:00 Porepunkah sign

00:31:58:00 a panning shot of Victorian alps

00:32:15:00 three women standing on a lookout with Victoria alps in the background

00:32:20:00 cross country skiers slowly ski away from the camera

00:33:17:00 two men skiing downhill on one set of skis

00:33:31:00 people ski jumping off a wooden ramp

00:35:11:00 children at a school sports meeting

00:37:13:00 a young boy and girl sit in hay with a dog in front of a car

00:37:34:00 shot of a lighthouse and seaside and flagpole

00:37:43:00 people at the beach filmed from behind and above

00:38:05:00 lighthouse with waves rolling in in the background

00:39:50:00 young children riding a horse

00:39:52:00 a boy and a girl ride bikes towards the camera in a backyard

00:40:24:00 boy fixing bike in backyard

00:40:39:00 boy playing with a gun in backyard

00:41:00:00 man feeding horses with mountains in the background

00:41:13:00 sheep running through a paddock gate

00:41:19:00 a girl riding a horse through a paddock with mountains seen in the background

00:41:25:00 man shearing a sheep with manual shears

00:41:56:00 a boy shears a sheep in school uniform

00:42:59:00 a girl dressed in school uniform rides a horse toward the camera

results.title: [Dr. Stuart Fraser Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
Dr Stuart Fraser (b.1898) was an amateur 16mm filmmaker. He studied medicine in Melbourne, graduating in 1923. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by his son, Graeme Fraser.

This film features children at play in Elwood, Victoria, in the 1930s.

In the film we a see a young toddler playing in a well-maintained suburban garden. The toddler can be seen playing with a variety of garden sprinklers, with and without water, and various toys.

A notable part sees a toddler riding a pony on the Elwood foreshore near Ormond Esplanade. The short glimpse we see of the houses in the background provides a fascinating, if very short, contrast to modern day Elwood.

Originally made using 16mm AGFA film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:56:00 toddler holding a metal cigarette case while watching a spinning sprinkler

00:01:13:00 man holding a toddler while they play with his reading glasses

00:01:58:00 dog jumping up trying to reach a teddy bear held by a child

00:02:09:00 lady holding string attached to a pram while rolling it down a driveway towards the camera

00:02:39:00 baby in yard with teddy bear

00:05:54:00 baby playing with a sprinkler

00:06:18:00 baby in a small tin bath

00:07:45:00 baby eating in highchair

00:08:24:00 baby playing with wooden clothes pegs

00:09:19:00 baby wearing man’s hat in backyard

00:10:03:00 baby playing with blocks, cards, and other toys on a rug in backyard

00:10:37:00 infant being held while wrapped in a blanket

00:11:01:00 toddler in backyard wearing a bag as a hat

00:11:35:00 a lady pushing a pram through botanical gardens, perhaps Royal Melbourne Botanic Gardens

00:12:25:00 baby in pram next to a pond with ducks

00:15:53:00 toddler riding a pony on the Elwood foreshore

00:17:22:00 infant on changing table

00:17:51:00 infant in tin bath

00:18:31:00 young girl playing with toy pram

00:18:59:00 young girl pushing a toy pram containing a teddy bear

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

The first part of this film briefly shows an outdoor art show before moving on to water ski jumping on the Yarra River – both are part of the ‘Moomba’ celebrations. The second part shows a road trip from Glenroy to Macedon ending at ‘Cameron Lodge’, Macedon all in Victoria.

Good views of the water ski jumping and the crowds watching from the banks. The road trip shows excellent views of small towns such as Keilor and Diggers Rest, vehicles passing on country roads and roadside scenes including telegraph poles.

Extensive views of the gardens of Cameron Lodge in Macedon including the rotunda, lake, stepping stones and family scenes in the garden.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:00:00 outdoor art show
00:00:44:00 Yarra River
00:01:00:00 the ‘Moomba’ festival on the riverbank
00:01:14:00 water skiing
00:02:00:00 water skiing over a jump
00:02:30:00 crowd watching from riverbank
00:03:40:00 title card ‘Glenroy to Macedon 4-3-61’
00:03:47:00 footage of car trip filmed from moving car showing country roads
00:04:38:00 car parked next to Keilor road sign. Good views of cars on road including VW beetle and Holdens, views of telegraph poles
00:05:05:00 road bridge with curved arch
00:05:10:00 ‘Keilor Hotel’ and parked cars, street scenes
00:05:20:00 Diggers Rest town scenes
00:05:40:00 countryside from moving car
00:06:35:00 Jacksons Creek bridge
00:07:28:00 small town with parked Holdens and BP service station
00:07:46:00 title card ‘Cameron Lodge Macedon 4-3-61’
00:07:52:00 views of Cameron Lodge and man walking in gardens
00:08:24:00 views of garden rotunda
00:08:37:00 two women and baby in lodge garden
00:08:40:00 man photographing garden
00:08:47:00 man in rotunda surrounded by lake, crossing stepping stones
00:09:21:00 group walk through lush vegetation including tree ferns
00:09:46:00 walking through lodge garden
00:10:03:00 children playing in rotunda and on stepping stones
00:10:46:00 group of children and adults on lakeside steps
00:11:10:00 title card ‘The End’
results.description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

The first part of this film briefly shows an outdoor art show before moving on to water ski jumping on the Yarra River – both are part of the ‘Moomba’ celebrations. The second part shows a road trip from Glenroy to Macedon ending at ‘Cameron Lodge’, Macedon all in Victoria.

Good views of the water ski jumping and the crowds watching from the banks. The road trip shows excellent views of small towns such as Keilor and Diggers Rest, vehicles passing on country roads and roadside scenes including telegraph poles.

Extensive views of the gardens of Cameron Lodge in Macedon including the rotunda, lake, stepping stones and family scenes in the garden.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:00:00 outdoor art show
00:00:44:00 Yarra River
00:01:00:00 the ‘Moomba’ festival on the riverbank
00:01:14:00 water skiing
00:02:00:00 water skiing over a jump
00:02:30:00 crowd watching from riverbank
00:03:40:00 title card ‘Glenroy to Macedon 4-3-61’

00:04:38:00 car parked next to Keilor road sign. Good views of cars on road including VW beetle and Holdens, views of telegraph poles
00:05:05:00 road bridge with curved arch
00:05:10:00 ‘Keilor Hotel’ and parked cars, street scenes
00:05:20:00 Diggers Rest town scenes
00:05:40:00 countryside from moving car
00:06:35:00 Jacksons Creek bridge
00:07:28:00 small town with parked Holdens and BP service station
00:07:46:00 title card ‘Cameron Lodge Macedon 4-3-61’
00:07:52:00 views of Cameron Lodge and man walking in gardens
00:08:24:00 views of garden rotunda
00:08:37:00 two women and baby in lodge garden
00:08:40:00 man photographing garden
00:08:47:00 man in rotunda surrounded by lake, crossing stepping stones
00:09:21:00 group walk through lush vegetation including tree ferns
00:09:46:00 walking through lodge garden
00:10:03:00 children playing in rotunda and on stepping stones
00:10:46:00 group of children and adults on lakeside steps
00:11:10:00 title card ‘The End’

group.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movie Collection]
group.material_description: 1 x DVD, 8mm, 16mm home movies and a 35mm film strip.

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

In this film, we spend time around a bay that is probably Port Phillip in Melbourne. Scenes are filmed on the piers and from the piers, capturing all the activity. There are lovely scenes of yachts sailing, people watching boat races, adults and children fishing and dockside workers undertaking their jobs on the piers.

The film also contains wonderful scenes of the celebration parade for the ‘Centenary of Essendon Municipal Government’ from 1961.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 a large ship
00:00:20:00 yachts on the bay with a pier in the foreground
00:01:03:00 a large 3-sail yacht tacking in the bay
00:01:19:00 a fishing rod in the foreground
00:01:20:00 children and adults fishing off the pier
00:01:28:00 men working with a tractor and pulley on the pier
00:02:02:00 pulleys being operated to take up large chains and an anchor on a pier
00:02:57:00 closer up to some yachts
00:02:05:00 motor boats on the bay
00:03:50:00 large yacht and passengers close up
00:04:07:00 a military ship
00:04:26:00 yachts racing on the bay
00:04:42:00 an older man, wearing a classic 1940s – 1950s style hat, standing on the pier looking out across the bay
00:05:00:00 a boy wearing rolled up trousers, fishing off the pier and more lovely yachts sailing by before we see a man and another boy who is lying down on the pier alongside his fishing rod
00:05:34:00 a motor boat goes by
00:05:42:00 a young man rowing a small rowboat
00:06:12:00 women wearing wide floral skirts, sitting on beach chairs on the pier, boys fishing and a bicycle
00:06:19:00 a tugboats travels past the pier
00:06:25:00 small cars on the pier
00:06:46:00 a large ship sails into the bay
00:06:55:00 two young boys collect a wicker fishing basket and rods
00:07:24:00 large passenger ship sails close by the end of the pier where some small cars are parked
00:07:40:00 seagulls flying by
00:07:46:00 program for the ‘Centenary of Municipal Government in Essendon 1861 – 1961, official Centennial Celebration program. Saturday December 9’
00:08:00:00 a military band leads a street parade
00:08:20:00 Australian Army members march by
00:08:30:00 various ‘floats’ as well as ‘marching girls’ go by in the celebratory parade
00:08:52:00 the Girl Guides ‘World Wide Friendship’ ‘float’ goes by followed by the Essendon Football Club
00:09:25:00 the Australian Navy contingent goes by, followed by the Victorian Railways ‘float’ showing off a train carriage and a bagpipes band in full regalia
00:10:00:00 – 00:11:15:00 participants in the parade include communities dressed in traditional costumes, the local library, more marching girls, local business and associations and schools, veterans groups and the RSL, a ‘supermarket float’ and a group of horse riders
00:11:33:00 the ‘Bowmen of Essendon’ go by followed by an ‘Australian made’ stilt walker, Christmas ‘floats’ and the Scouts
00:12:05:00 the Australian Air Force, a glimpse of some walking ‘briquettes’ and some girls who might be a netball team or school group
00:12:15:00 young women modelling smart outfits of the day including hats and gloves being driven in a sports car followed by a ‘float’ for a local ‘dance hall’
00:12:45:00 ‘Home Pride Bread horse drawn van goes by with decorations and a young woman ‘baker’, followed by a giant paint tin ‘float’
00:12:53:00 a car and boat accompanied by ‘sea scouts’
00:13:07:00 ‘Essendon Brass Band’ marches by followed by the Ukraine community group in costumes and a local hospital or medical group
00:13:19:00 handmade card for ‘Essendon 1961’
